ai-patthana16.41:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.41:1.1_0: You shouldn’t have any cause or condition for the sake of nature.
ai-patthana16.41:1.1_1: The cause and condition that gives rise to the reason for the sake of nature, or for the sake of natural principles,
ai-patthana16.41:1.1_2: You don’t have the cause or condition for the sake of not accumulating; and you won’t give rise to the cause or condition for the sake of teaching.
ai-patthana16.41:1.1_3: Neither causes and reasons: three kinds of support for the sake of interruption ...
ai-patthana16.41:1.1_5: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
